How to Install gtkpool on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • gtkpool

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install gtkpool on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing gtkpool on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall gtkpool in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install gtkpool, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install gtkpool Using apt

To install gtkpool in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install gtkpool using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install gtkpool

The installation of gtkpool might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install gtkpool Using apt-get

To install gtkpool using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install gtkpool.

sudo apt-get -y install gtkpool

Install gtkpool Using Synaptic

To install gtkpool using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install gtkpool on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for gtkpool. This will display the gtkpool package in the package window, now to install gtkpool, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the gtkpool package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of gtkpool.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install gtkpool Using aptitude

To install gtkpool on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of gtkpool.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install gtkpool using the command aptitude install gtkpool.

sudo aptitude -y install gtkpool

How to Upgrade gtkpool on debian

If you want to upgrade the gtkpool package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade gtkpool using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade gtkpool to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade gtkpool.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade gtkpool sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade gtkpool

Upgrade gtkpool using Aptitude

To upgrade gtkpool using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade gtkpool.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade gtkpool

Upgrade gtkpool using Synaptic

To upgrade gtkpool using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for gtkpool, now right-click gtkpool, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade gtkpool just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall gtkpool on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall gtkpool from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just gtkpool, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove gtkpool

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of gtkpool

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of gtkpool you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge gtkpool

Remove gtkpool using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall gtkpool using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for gtkpool, right-click the gtkpool package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall gtkpool click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install gtkpool on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade gtkpool using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of gtkpool then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
